com.jcodeing.kmedia.assist

Class MediaButtonReceiverHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jcodeing.kmedia.assist.MediaButtonReceiverHelper

  • public class MediaButtonReceiverHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Media Key Receiver Helper A media button receiver helper.

    You can add this MediaButtonReceiverHelper$MBR to your app by adding it directly to your AndroidManifest.xml: 

     <receiver android:name="com.jcodeing.kmedia.assist.MediaButtonReceiverHelper$MBR" >
   <intent-filter>
     <action android:name="android.intent.action.MEDIA_BUTTON" />
   </intent-filter>
 </receiver>
    WARNING: use default media button receiver(MediaButtonReceiverHelper.MBR), be sure toã€€setPlayerAskFor(PlayerAskFor) or setOnMediaButtonEventListener(OnMediaButtonEventListener) go to complete a full feats, if not will be a waste of resources.

      • setDefaultMediaButtonReceiverToSole

        public void setDefaultMediaButtonReceiverToSole(android.content.Context context,
                                                boolean isSole)
        Sets default media button receiver(MediaButtonReceiverHelper.MBR) to to be the sole receiver of MEDIA_BUTTON intents.

      • setPlayerAskFor

        public void setPlayerAskFor(MediaButtonReceiverHelper.PlayerAskFor playerAskFor)
        assist internal complete a full feats.

        mainly applied to auto processing default MediaButtonReceiverHelper.MBR->onMediaButtonEvent(KeyEvent)->KeyCode

      • setOnMediaButtonEventListener

        public void setOnMediaButtonEventListener(MediaButtonReceiverHelper.OnMediaButtonEventListener onMediaButtonEventListener)
        Default media button receiver -> onReceive, priority to callback listener

      • onMediaButtonEvent

        public boolean onMediaButtonEvent(android.view.KeyEvent keyEvent)
        Called to process media key events. Only media key events will be handled.

        WARNING: priority to callback media button event listener(MediaButtonReceiverHelper.OnMediaButtonEventListener.onMediaButtonEvent(KeyEvent)), if there is no handled, with me handle(*Does nothing if not invoke setPlayerAskFor(PlayerAskFor))

        Returns:
        Whether the key event was handled
